According to Arsene Wenger, he is happy with Alexis Sanchez's decision to join Arsenal last summer. This implies that Wenger feels that Sanchez is a valuable asset to the team and that the club made the right decision in signing him.

Alexis Sanchez made an impact in English football since joining Arsenal last summer for £32 million from Barcelona. The Chilean forward was also linked with Liverpool and Manchester City before deciding to sign with Arsenal. Arsene Wenger, the Arsenal manager, believes that Sanchez is one of the best players in the world. Sanchez's impact has been evident this season, as he has already scored 16 goals in all competitions for Arsenal. On Saturday, Arsenal will host Liverpool at the Emirates Stadium and Sanchez will look to continue his excellent form.

The given aspect states that Arsenal and Liverpool were in negotiations. This means that there were talks and discussions between the two teams regarding a possible transfer or trade of players or other business deals. The negotiations may have been about a potential deal for Alexis Sanchez, who was also linked with Liverpool and Manchester City last summer. It is not known what came out of these negotiations, but they could have played a role in Sanchez ultimately deciding to join Arsenal for £32million from Barcelona.
Arsene Wenger believes that Alexis Sanchez is one of the best players in the world, and therefore he was willing to spend £32 million to bring him to Arsenal from Barcelona last summer.
The aspect highlights that Wenger played down talk of a potential transfer for Sterling.
Arsene Wenger praised Brendan Rodgers for his work with Liverpool.
